body: :( that will be my fault I guess.

What's the file size? It seems all files are below 128kb?
Can I make a debug build for you which would do some more logging?

I thought I caught all the bugs, but that doesn't seem to be the case.

Sizes in byte:
1993 LOT_MSH-300_SN17969_mod.xml 
11589 plot_day_3.pdf
11522 plot_day_5.pdf
11491 plot_day_9.pdf

Sure, i can test a debug build.
Also, can you try and copy the files and see if it happens again?
copying the file fixes it, let's see for how long...

ok changed one file and it's in this state again...
On the pulling node `.syncthing.LOT_MSH-300_SN17969_mod.xml` and `LOT_MSH-300_SN17969_mod.xml` are the same and it's the old file, not the changed one.

This time also another node that shares the repo got in the same bugged state.

Can you download a build from:
http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-branch/lastSuccessfulBuild/

You don't need to set any debug flags, but make sure you redirect the output as it might produce a lot of it.

here you have the log:

http://alex-graf.de/public/st/2014-10-22.txt

Deleting your index should fix this.
I am not sure how this happened though.

@calmh it seems that files.Update was called with an incorrect block, making me believe there is race condition?
Should I add verification to the copier? But that means hashing as we copy :(

deleting the index on pulling node only fixed it for a really short time...
I changed the file again and it's broken again, log: http://alex-graf.de/public/st/2014-10-22_2.txt

Can you remove the index again, and try again, but this time produce the whole log?
Because this seems to be only part of it, because I cannot see the file in question being indexed.
You're supposed to have something like:

```
Updating "Dokumente/notizen.txt" first block Block{0/2369/759e223351e9e6e127302bc63726d1691ec15a96132c7c1b428a7c6eff1b71ba}
```

this should be the whole log, did not delete anything... or should i set some STTRACE also?
'Dokumente/notizen.txt' was successfully pulled, the not working file is 'LOT_...'

forget this, i restarted syncthing after indexing which was overwriting my log, so the indexing is not part of this log

Yeah, I see the successfully pulled file.
Switch syncthing off, delete the index and start again, let's see what it produces this time.
It should say "Pulling first block" for every existing file that has changed.

There could be a race between the initial scan and the first pull...
Is it happening on one specific node, or is this spreading?

saw it on at least 3 nodes.
Log with everything since the index scan until the shutdown after the error was there again: http://alex-graf.de/public/st/2014-10-22_3.txt

Thanks, this one seems more like it.
Let me dig into it.

I understand the issue now, thanks.
I'll have to lean on @calmh to solve it though.

The file is changing though it seems, as it gets indexed as `b2e71852417290e995766b4b8b2b8bb2bf5bfecb5e957bf1e44a9c6e0f3b223a`, then an updated arrives saying it is now `1a92cf6d3583a517e623e0713ff4cb23174d4b829e3894d5b94f4a47a704b45a`, and then another update arrives saying that it is now back to being `b2e71852417290e995766b4b8b2b8bb2bf5bfecb5e957bf1e44a9c6e0f3b223a`?

I am just verifying the scenario, not denying the existence of the bug!
that sounds correct because i changed it back.

I've not reproduced the issue quite easily.

```
echo "a" > test
```

wait for sync

```
echo "b" > test
```

wait for sync

```
echo "a" > test
```

Boom.
yeah that easy test reproduces it :laughing: so changing file and the reverting the change is the issue...

Can you try
http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-branch/lastSuccessfulBuild/
just remove your indexes before hand on the nodes that had trouble.
seems to work, thx :)

@calmh look at the puller-fix and tell me if you can think of something better.
Also, I guess we'll need a migration zapping the blockmaps from index as they are now dirty :(
